jorisvandenbossche commented on a change in pull request #7631:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7631#discussion_r449556844



##########
File path: python/pyarrow/_dataset.pyx
##########
@@ -773,6 +789,14 @@ cdef class FileFragment(Fragment):
         Fragment.init(self, sp)
         self.file_fragment = <CFileFragment*> sp.get()
 
+    def __reduce__(self):
+        buffer = self.buffer
+        return self.format.make_fragment, (

Review comment:
       By specifying here the method on a format object (`format.make_fragment`), it also automatically pickles the `format` *instance* ?

##########
File path: python/pyarrow/_dataset.pyx
##########
@@ -887,6 +911,14 @@ cdef class ParquetFileFragment(FileFragment):
         FileFragment.init(self, sp)
         self.parquet_file_fragment = <CParquetFileFragment*> sp.get()
 
+    def __reduce__(self):
+        return self.format.make_fragment, (
+            self.path,

Review comment:
       I suppose you might need to do the same `self.path if buffer is None else buffer,` here as you did for `FileFragment` ?

##########
File path: python/pyarrow/_dataset.pyx
##########
@@ -773,6 +789,14 @@ cdef class FileFragment(Fragment):
         Fragment.init(self, sp)
         self.file_fragment = <CFileFragment*> sp.get()
 
+    def __reduce__(self):
+        buffer = self.buffer
+        return self.format.make_fragment, (

Review comment:
       We should maybe ensure this with testing a picking roundtrip for a case that specified read params in the ParquetFileFormat object

     assert pickled.to_table().equals(fragment.to_table())
 
 
+@pytest.mark.parquet
+def test_make_parquet_fragment_from_buffer():
+    import pyarrow.parquet as pq
+
+    table = pa.table([['a', 'b', 'c'],
+                      [12, 11, 10],
+                      ['dog', 'cat', 'rabbit']],
+                     names=['alpha', 'num', 'animal'])
+
+    out = pa.BufferOutputStream()
+    pq.write_table(table, out)
+
+    buffer = out.getvalue()
+
+    formats = [
+        ds.ParquetFileFormat(),
+        ds.ParquetFileFormat(
+            read_options=ds.ParquetReadOptions(
+                use_buffered_stream=True,
+                buffer_size=4096,

Review comment:
       we probably need to use an option that actually alters the output to be able to catch a failure, eg `dictionary_columns`

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: We alraedy made several parts of a Dataset serializable (the formats, the expressions, the filesystem). With those, it should also be possible to pickle FileFragments, and with that also Dataset.

comments.body: [~jorisvandenbossche] is this required for anything in particular or just nice to have?

[~jorisvandenbossche] It's not always the case now that we support buffers as fragments, of course we could raise in that case. Do we want to do the serialization on the python side of on the c++ side similar to the expression classes?

cc [~bkietz]

I would first focus on Fragments (I actually thought those were already serializable, but apparently not, should have opened an issue for that instead of Dataset). 
I would _think_ that this can be handled in Python, since a Fragment is "just" a format + file path/buffer + schema + filesystem + partition expression, and all those parts are already serializable.

Since FileFragment supports file handlers/buffers it makes the possible implementation a bit more complicated. Certain components of the dataset API are already serializable on the C++ side, so I assume we should make that implementation complete before adding pickling for DataFragments.  cc [~bkietz]

Personally, I wouldn't worry too much about file handles/buffers initially. A buffer can be serialized as is? And if the Fragment is not backed by a path or buffer (eg a handle), we can simply raise an error when trying to pickle (or at least initially) ?

So for a fragment: filesytem and expressions are already serializable, I think. In addition, we need to serialize the path/buffer. 
For a ParquetFragment probably the more complicating factor is also serializing the RowGroupInfo (which will need some more custom code, since right now there is not yet API exposed to create those with statistics from Python)
